paper_abstract: Increasing the level of detail (LOD) in brushstrokes within areas of interest improved the realism of painterly rendering. Using a modified quad-tree, we segmented an image into areas with similar levels of saliency; each of these segments was then used to control the brush strokes during rendering. We could also simulate real oil painting steps based on saliency information. Our method runs in a reasonable fine and produces results that are visually appealing and competitive with previous techniques.
paper_title: A multi-level depiction method for painterly rendering based on visual perception cue
